column5: HI. we are having to bring our little snauzer with us this year, what kind of papers will I need for her? anyone else ever bring their dog with for just a fishing trip? thanks.

I brought my brit twice to Ontario... Each way was not an issue in either ditrecton. I got paper from the veterinary about all the shots. No one ever asked for it..noone ever even look what was in the crate...

Shouldn't be a problem. Just make sure your pup doesn't have any misdemeanors otherwise a border agent "could" deny entry for your dog at his/her discretion. Sorry I couldn't resist commenting because of a thread that has got a lot of correspondence from both sides regarding the "rules" on who is allowed entry into Canada. All kidding aside.... Just bring a current vaccinations report from your vet. You probably won't even be asked for them.
You probably will be asked about your dog food containing chicken byproducts!!!! Later, Jay

The rules require proof of a rabies shot within the last 30 days but I have never been asked for it. On the way back, if you cross at IFalls pooch has a good chance of scoring a dog biscuit from the far right border agent station.Dogs seem to be a nonissue when crossing.

Hummm...Doesn't Ontario have some sort of full out ban on certain dog breeds? I seem to remember the a ban on American bulldogs aka Pit Bulls, but the scary part is dogs that look like pit bulls.http://dogcare.dailypuppy.com/list-d...ment-4034.htmlB-
LOLOLOL I was actually going to make a comment like this.
American bulldogs are not the same as pitbulls. Pitbulls are terriers, American bulldogs come from mastiffs and english bulldogs- so you can't say aka pitbulls. "****zu's aka rottweilers"
Took our dog last year with zero issues. Fun having him up there!
